comments:
Friendly DSL for Data-Driven Attributes

A more approachable API for the finally-tagless expression system.
Designed for D3.js developers learning PureScript.

## Quick Start

```purescript
import PSD3.Expr.Friendly

-- Define field accessors for your data type
_x = field @"x"
_y = field @"y"
_name = field @"name"

-- Build expressions with readable arithmetic
xPosition = _x `times` 40.0 `plus` 50.0
yPosition = _y `times` 30.0

-- Create attributes
myAttrs =
  [ computed "cx" xPosition
  , computed "cy" yPosition
  , staticStr "fill" "steelblue"
  ]
```

## Value Constructors

- `num 42.0` - numeric value
- `text "hello"` - string value
- `bool true` - boolean value

## Arithmetic (use with backticks for infix)

- `plus`, `minus`, `times`, `dividedBy` - binary operations
- `negated` - unary negation

## Attribute Constructors

- `computed` - data-driven numeric/showable attribute
- `computedStr` - data-driven string attribute
- `static` - constant numeric/showable attribute
- `staticStr` - constant string attribute
- `from` - escape hatch using plain PureScript function

declarations.comments:
Create a numeric value

```purescript
radius = num 5.0
scaled = _x `times` num 20.0  -- or use `timesN` to skip the `num`
```
declarations.title: num

declarations.comments:
Create a text (string) value

```purescript
fill = text "steelblue"
label = _name `append` text " (selected)"
```
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments:
Create a boolean value

```purescript
visible = bool true
```
declarations.title: bool

declarations.comments:
Add two expressions

```purescript
total = _x `plus` _y
offset = _index `times` num 40.0 `plus` num 50.0
```
declarations.title: plus

declarations.comments: Subtract expressions
declarations.title: minus

declarations.comments:
Multiply expressions

```purescript
scaled = _value `times` num 2.0
```
declarations.title: times

declarations.comments: Divide expressions
declarations.title: dividedBy

declarations.comments: Negate an expression
declarations.title: negated

declarations.comments: Add a literal number: `_x `plusN` 50.0`
declarations.title: plusN

declarations.comments: Subtract a literal number
declarations.title: minusN

declarations.comments: Multiply by a literal number: `_index `timesN` 40.0`
declarations.title: timesN

declarations.comments: Divide by a literal number
declarations.title: dividedByN

declarations.comments: Less than comparison
declarations.title: lessThan

declarations.comments: Less than or equal
declarations.title: lessOrEqual

declarations.comments: Greater than comparison
declarations.title: greaterThan

declarations.comments: Greater than or equal
declarations.title: greaterOrEqual

declarations.comments: Numeric equality
declarations.title: equals

declarations.comments: String equality
declarations.title: textEquals

declarations.comments: String inequality
declarations.title: textNotEquals

declarations.comments: Boolean AND (use underscore to avoid keyword conflict)
declarations.title: and_

declarations.comments: Boolean OR
declarations.title: or_

declarations.comments: Boolean NOT
declarations.title: not_

declarations.comments:
Conditional expression

```purescript
fillColor = ifThen (_value `greaterThan` num 50.0)
              (text "red")
              (text "blue")
```
declarations.title: ifThen

declarations.comments:
Concatenate strings

```purescript
label = _name `append` text ": " `append` _value
```
declarations.title: append

declarations.comments:
Access a field from the datum

Define field accessors for your data type:

```purescript
type MyDataRow = (x :: Number, y :: Number, name :: String)

_x :: forall repr. DatumExpr repr MyDataRow => repr Number
_x = field @"x"

_y :: forall repr. DatumExpr repr MyDataRow => repr Number
_y = field @"y"

_name :: forall repr. DatumExpr repr MyDataRow => repr String
_name = field @"name"
```
declarations.title: field

declarations.comments: Access the element index (for staggered animations, positioning by index)
declarations.title: index

declarations.comments:
Create a data-driven attribute from an expression.
Works for both numeric and string expressions - no need for separate functions!

```purescript
attr "cx" $ _x `timesN` 20.0 `plusN` 50.0
attr "r" $ num 5.0
attr "fill" $ text "steelblue"
attr "fill" $ ifThen condition (text "red") (text "blue")
```
declarations.title: attr

declarations.comments:
Create a data-driven attribute that also uses the element index

```purescript
attrWithIndex "x" $ index `timesN` 50.0
```
declarations.title: attrWithIndex

declarations.comments:
Create a static (constant) attribute

```purescript
static "stroke-width" 2.0
static "opacity" 0.8
```
declarations.title: static

declarations.comments:
Create a static string attribute (no quotes)

```purescript
staticStr "fill" "steelblue"
staticStr "stroke" "none"
```
declarations.title: staticStr
from

declarations.comments:
Create a string attribute from a plain function

```purescript
fromStr "class" _.category
fromStr "fill" (\d -> if d.active then "green" else "gray")
```
declarations.title: fromStr

declarations.comments:
Create an indexed attribute from a function taking datum and index

```purescript
fromWithIndex "x" (\d i -> toNumber i * 50.0)
```
declarations.title: fromWithIndex

declarations.comments: Create an indexed string attribute from a function
declarations.title: fromStrWithIndex

declarations.comments:
Create a viewBox attribute with structured parameters

```purescript
viewBox 0.0 0.0 800.0 600.0  -- instead of staticStr "viewBox" "0 0 800 600"
```
declarations.title: viewBox

declarations.comments:
CSS class attribute (underscore suffix since `class` is a reserved word)

```purescript
class_ $ text "my-element highlighted"
```
declarations.title: class_

children.comments: Colors convert to hex strings for SVG attributes
children.title: <anonymous>

declarations.comments: Re-export Color type for type-safe fills and strokes
declarations.title: Color

declarations.comments:
Create a color expression from a Color value

```purescript
fill $ color steelblue
```
declarations.title: color

declarations.comments:
Parse a hex color string

```purescript
fill $ hex "#2c3e50"
```
declarations.title: hex

declarations.comments:
Create a color from RGB values (0-255)

```purescript
fill $ rgb_ 44 62 80
```
declarations.title: rgb_

declarations.comments:
Create a color from HSL values (hue 0-360, saturation/lightness 0.0-1.0)

```purescript
fill $ hsl_ 210.0 0.5 0.3
```
declarations.title: hsl_

declarations.comments: Pure black color
declarations.title: black

declarations.comments: Pure white color
declarations.title: white

declarations.comments:
Lighten a color by a factor (0.0 to 1.0)

```purescript
fill $ lighten 0.2 (hex "#3498db")
```
declarations.title: lighten

declarations.comments: Darken a color by a factor (0.0 to 1.0)
declarations.title: darken

declarations.comments: Increase saturation by a factor
declarations.title: saturate

declarations.comments: Decrease saturation by a factor
declarations.title: desaturate

declarations.comments: Pixels
declarations.title: Px

declarations.comments:
Create a pixel value

```purescript
fontSize $ px 16.0
```
declarations.title: px

declarations.comments: Points (1pt = 1/72 inch)
declarations.title: Pt

declarations.comments:
Create a point value

```purescript
fontSize $ pt 12.0
```
declarations.title: pt

declarations.comments: Em units (relative to parent font size)
declarations.title: Em

declarations.comments:
Create an em value (note: em_ to avoid conflict with Prelude's em)

```purescript
fontSize $ em_ 1.5
```
declarations.title: em_

declarations.comments: Rem units (relative to root font size)
declarations.title: Rem

declarations.comments:
Create a rem value

```purescript
fontSize $ rem_ 1.0
```
declarations.title: rem_

declarations.comments: Percentage
declarations.title: Percent

declarations.comments:
Create a percentage value

```purescript
width $ pct 100.0
```
declarations.title: pct

declarations.comments:
Evaluate an expression with a datum (index defaults to 0)

```purescript
x = eval scaleX datum  -- instead of runEvalD scaleX datum 0
```
declarations.title: eval

declarations.comments:
Evaluate an expression with datum and explicit index

```purescript
x = evalAt scaleX datum 5
```
declarations.title: evalAt

declarations.comments:
Create a data-driven attribute from an expression

```purescript
computed "cx" (_x `timesN` 20.0 `plusN` 50.0)
computed "r" (num 5.0)
```
declarations.title: computed

declarations.comments:
Create a data-driven string attribute (no quotes added)

```purescript
computedStr "fill" (ifThen condition (text "red") (text "blue"))
computedStr "class" _category
```
declarations.title: computedStr

declarations.comments:
Create a data-driven attribute that also uses the element index

```purescript
computedWithIndex "x" (index `timesN` 50.0)
```
declarations.title: computedWithIndex

declarations.comments: Create a data-driven string attribute that also uses the element index
declarations.title: computedStrWithIndex

children.comments: Colors convert to hex strings for SVG attributes
children.title: <anonymous>

declarations.comments:
Typeclass for converting values to attribute strings.
String values pass through unchanged, other types use Show.
This allows `attr` to work for both numeric and string expressions.
declarations.title: ToAttributeValue

name: PSD3.Expr.Friendly
